div.p: As your Superintendent, I want you to know that we’re here to support and care for our commUNITY through consistent communication, resources, and hope.
As we progress through this challenging event, we’ll continue communicating – letting you know what we know, when we know it. Please click below for our daily message.

span.span: Stay Connected during the COVID-19 event

div.class: has_eae_slider elementor-element elementor-element-4b2b09a2 elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column

span.style: color: rgb(122, 122, 122); font-family: Poppins, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: 300; white-space: normal;

p.span: On April 6, we will transition to a Remote Learning Environment. While our staff prepares for this shift, you'll find many resources designed for your student.

p.span: Learn more about Mason City Schools' mental wellness supports. Get strategies for coping during this time.

p.span: Find out how to obtain a Chromebook if your child doesn't have a device. Learn how to get support for the weeks ahead.

p.span: No one in our community should go hungry. Find out how to get food, and how MCS is supporting our families facing food insecurity.

elementor-element elementor-element-59128cc9 elementor-position-top elementor-vertical-align-top elementor-widget elementor-widget-image-box

font.span: This is a very crucial time for many people in our community. We know that our Comet CommUNITY is always ready to assist. Find ways to support families, local businesses (especially those in hospitality) and others who need our help.

elementor-element elementor-element-34c874c7 elementor-testimonial--layout-image_left elementor-testimonial--align-left elementor-testimonial--skin-bubble elementor-widget elementor-widget-testimonial-carousel

div.div: “Even during difficult times, I feel confident in our staff, students and community because of our district’s 3 Big Rocks. We are thinking of our students and families during this time and want you to know our high school staff is here for you as we begin this new journey. While this is a new challenge, the MHS staff takes great pride in “Staying in the Moment” and responding to these events so all of our students and families grow each day and continue to fulfill our Comet Culture as learners.”

“What a blessing it is that we have been working on our Comet Culture and our understanding of E+R=O before this COVID-19 Event came our way. I feel very fortunate to be responding to the unfortunate event with our Mason Comet community.”

“Our staff, students and community has had to learn to adjust and adapt on the fly over the past two weeks. The staff at MI is “Owning the Moment” and working to stay connected to students and plan lessons that will continue the learning. We miss seeing our students on a daily basis but look forward to taking this journey together. Stay healthy and safe! Stay MI Strong!”

“It has been heartwarming to see the expressions of kindness and hope from our ME Comets. We are continuing to live our school motto, ‘Kindness Starts with M.E.’ by reaching out to members of Comet Country to connect with them and let them know we care for them. The Mason Elementary staff is committed to supporting our students and families.”

“It’s never been more important to live out our Comet Kid stances and to exercise persistence, empathy, flexibility, resilience and optimism. Our families, staff and students have all been sharing stories of how living out these attributes is truly life changing in this moment. We are so proud of our Comet Kids in the Mason Community!!”

div.h2: Whether it is food, mental wellness supports, technology, or learning resources - we're here for our Mason and deerfield township community.
